intro: Ficus popayanensis, commonly known as the Popayán fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the Andean region of Colombia, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces edible figs that are often used in local cuisine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
